p: In summary, our study found that EV71 virus infection induced SOCS mRNA level expression in vitro and in vivo. SOCS1 and SOCS3 may promote virus infection by inhibiting IFN-induced STAT3 phosphorylation. In the early stage, the induction of SOCS gene transcription was an IFN-independent manner and could be blocked by the NF- ÎºB inhibitor. All these results may add a new aspect to our knowledge of the strategies used by the EV71 virus to fight against type I IFN responses.
